00019 int
00020 wapi_get_we_version(int sock, const char *ifname, int *we_version)
00021 {
00022     struct iwreq wrq;
00023     char buf[sizeof(struct iw_range) * 2];
00024     int ret;
00025 
00026     WAPI_VALIDATE_PTR(we_version);
00027 
00028     /* Prepare request. */
00029     bzero(buf, sizeof(buf));
00030     wrq.u.data.pointer = buf;
00031     wrq.u.data.length = sizeof(buf);
00032     wrq.u.data.flags = 0;
00033 
00034     /* Get WE version. */
00035     strncpy(wrq.ifr_name, ifname, IFNAMSIZ);
00036     if ((ret = ioctl(sock, SIOCGIWRANGE, &wrq)) >= 0)
00037     {
00038         struct iw_range *range = (struct iw_range *) buf;
00039         *we_version = (int) range->we_version_compiled;
00040     }
00041     else WAPI_IOCTL_STRERROR(SIOCGIWRANGE);
00042 
00043     return ret;
00044 }

00047 /*-- Frequency ---------------------------------------------------------------*/
00048 
00049 
00050 const char *wapi_freq_flags[] = {
00051     "WAPI_FREQ_AUTO",
00052     "WAPI_FREQ_FIXED"
00053 };
00054 
00055 
00056 /**
00057  * Converts internal representation of frequencies to a floating point.
00058  */
00059 static inline double
00060 wapi_freq2float(const struct iw_freq *freq)
00061 {
00062     return ((double) freq->m) * pow(10, freq->e);
00063 }
00064 
00065 
00066 /**
00067  * Converts a floating point the our internal representation of frequencies.
00068  */
00069 static inline void
00070 wapi_float2freq(double floatfreq, struct iw_freq *freq)
00071 {
00072     freq->e = (short) floor(log10(floatfreq));
00073     if (freq->e > 8)
00074     {
00075         freq->m = ((long) (floor(floatfreq / pow(10,freq->e - 6)))) * 100;
00076         freq->e -= 8;
00077     }
00078     else
00079     {
00080         freq->m = (long) floatfreq;
00081         freq->e = 0;
00082     }
00083 }
00084 
00085 
00086 int
00087 wapi_get_freq(int sock, const char *ifname, double *freq, wapi_freq_flag_t *flag)
00088 {
00089     struct iwreq wrq;
00090     int ret;
00091 
00092     WAPI_VALIDATE_PTR(freq);
00093     WAPI_VALIDATE_PTR(flag);
00094 
00095     strncpy(wrq.ifr_name, ifname, IFNAMSIZ);
00096     if ((ret = ioctl(sock, SIOCGIWFREQ, &wrq)) >= 0)
00097     {
00098         /* Set flag. */
00099         if (IW_FREQ_AUTO == (wrq.u.freq.flags & IW_FREQ_AUTO))
00100             *flag = WAPI_FREQ_AUTO;
00101         else if (IW_FREQ_FIXED == (wrq.u.freq.flags & IW_FREQ_FIXED))
00102             *flag = WAPI_FREQ_FIXED;
00103         else
00104         {
00105             WAPI_ERROR("Unknown flag: %d.\n", wrq.u.freq.flags);
00106             return -1;
00107         }
00108 
00109         /* Set freq. */
00110         *freq = wapi_freq2float(&(wrq.u.freq));
00111     }
00112 
00113     return ret;
00114 }
00115 
00116 
00117 int
00118 wapi_set_freq(int sock, const char *ifname, double freq, wapi_freq_flag_t flag)
00119 {
00120     struct iwreq wrq;
00121     int ret;
00122 
00123     /* Set freq. */
00124     wapi_float2freq(freq, &(wrq.u.freq));
00125 
00126     /* Set flag. */
00127     switch (flag)
00128     {
00129     case WAPI_FREQ_AUTO:
00130         wrq.u.freq.flags = IW_FREQ_AUTO;
00131         break;
00132     case WAPI_FREQ_FIXED:
00133         wrq.u.freq.flags = IW_FREQ_FIXED;
00134         break;
00135     }
00136 
00137     strncpy(wrq.ifr_name, ifname, IFNAMSIZ);
00138     ret = ioctl(sock, SIOCSIWFREQ, &wrq);
00139     if (ret < 0) WAPI_IOCTL_STRERROR(SIOCSIWFREQ);
00140 
00141     return ret;
00142 }
00143 
00144 
00145 int
00146 wapi_get_chan(int sock, const char *ifname, double freq, int *chan)
00147 {
00148     struct iwreq wrq;
00149     char buf[sizeof(struct iw_range) * 2];
00150     int ret;
00151 
00152     WAPI_VALIDATE_PTR(chan);
00153 
00154     /* Prepare request. */
00155     bzero(buf, sizeof(buf));
00156     wrq.u.data.pointer = buf;
00157     wrq.u.data.length = sizeof(buf);
00158     wrq.u.data.flags = 0;
00159 
00160     /* Get range. */
00161     strncpy(wrq.ifr_name, ifname, IFNAMSIZ);
00162     if ((ret = ioctl(sock, SIOCGIWRANGE, &wrq)) >= 0)
00163     {
00164         struct iw_range *range = (struct iw_range *) buf;
00165         int k;
00166 
00167         /* Compare the frequencies as double to ignore differences in encoding.
00168          * Slower, but safer... */
00169         for (k = 0; k < range->num_frequency; k++)
00170             if (freq == wapi_freq2float(&(range->freq[k])))
00171             {
00172                 *chan = range->freq[k].i;
00173                 return 0;
00174             }
00175 
00176         /* Oops! Nothing found. */
00177         ret = -2;
00178     }
00179     else WAPI_IOCTL_STRERROR(SIOCGIWRANGE);
00180 
00181     return ret;
00182 }

00193 
00194 int
00195 wapi_get_essid(
00196     int sock,
00197     const char *ifname,
00198     char *essid,
00199     wapi_essid_flag_t *flag)
00200 {
00201     struct iwreq wrq;
00202     int ret;
00203 
00204     WAPI_VALIDATE_PTR(essid);
00205     WAPI_VALIDATE_PTR(flag);
00206 
00207     wrq.u.essid.pointer = essid;
00208     wrq.u.essid.length = WAPI_ESSID_MAX_SIZE + 1;
00209     wrq.u.essid.flags = 0;
00210 
00211     strncpy(wrq.ifr_name, ifname, IFNAMSIZ);
00212     ret = ioctl(sock, SIOCGIWESSID, &wrq);
00213     if (ret < 0) WAPI_IOCTL_STRERROR(SIOCGIWESSID);
00214     else *flag = (wrq.u.essid.flags) ? WAPI_ESSID_ON : WAPI_ESSID_OFF;
00215 
00216     return ret;
00217 }

00220 int
00221 wapi_set_essid(
00222     int sock,
00223     const char *ifname,
00224     const char *essid,
00225     wapi_essid_flag_t flag)
00226 {
00227     char buf[WAPI_ESSID_MAX_SIZE + 1];
00228     struct iwreq wrq;
00229     int ret;
00230 
00231     /* Prepare request. */
00232     wrq.u.essid.pointer = buf;
00233     wrq.u.essid.length =
00234         snprintf(buf, ((WAPI_ESSID_MAX_SIZE + 1) * sizeof(char)), "%s", essid);
00235     wrq.u.essid.flags = (flag == WAPI_ESSID_ON);
00236 
00237     strncpy(wrq.ifr_name, ifname, IFNAMSIZ);
00238     ret = ioctl(sock, SIOCSIWESSID, &wrq);
00239     if (ret < 0) WAPI_IOCTL_STRERROR(SIOCSIWESSID);
00240 
00241     return ret;
00242 }

00258 
00259 static int
00260 wapi_parse_mode(int iw_mode, wapi_mode_t *wapi_mode)
00261 {
00262     switch (iw_mode)
00263     {
00264     case WAPI_MODE_AUTO:
00265     case WAPI_MODE_ADHOC:
00266     case WAPI_MODE_MANAGED:
00267     case WAPI_MODE_MASTER:
00268     case WAPI_MODE_REPEAT:
00269     case WAPI_MODE_SECOND:
00270     case WAPI_MODE_MONITOR:
00271         *wapi_mode = iw_mode;
00272         return 0;
00273 
00274     default:
00275         WAPI_ERROR("Unknown mode: %d.\n", iw_mode);
00276         return -1;
00277     }
00278 }

00281 int
00282 wapi_get_mode(int sock, const char *ifname, wapi_mode_t *mode)
00283 {
00284     struct iwreq wrq;
00285     int ret;
00286 
00287     WAPI_VALIDATE_PTR(mode);
00288 
00289     strncpy(wrq.ifr_name, ifname, IFNAMSIZ);
00290     if ((ret = ioctl(sock, SIOCGIWMODE, &wrq)) >= 0)
00291         ret = wapi_parse_mode(wrq.u.mode, mode);
00292     else WAPI_IOCTL_STRERROR(SIOCGIWMODE);
00293 
00294     return ret;
00295 }

00340 int
00341 wapi_get_ap(int sock, const char *ifname, struct ether_addr *ap)
00342 {
00343     struct iwreq wrq;
00344     int ret;
00345 
00346     WAPI_VALIDATE_PTR(ap);
00347 
00348     strncpy(wrq.ifr_name, ifname, IFNAMSIZ);
00349     if ((ret = ioctl(sock, SIOCGIWAP, &wrq)) >= 0)
00350         memcpy(ap, wrq.u.ap_addr.sa_data, sizeof(struct ether_addr));
00351     else WAPI_IOCTL_STRERROR(SIOCGIWAP);
00352

00356 
00357 int
00358 wapi_set_ap(int sock, const char *ifname, const struct ether_addr *ap)
00359 {
00360     struct iwreq wrq;
00361     int ret;
00362 
00363     WAPI_VALIDATE_PTR(ap);
00364 
00365     wrq.u.ap_addr.sa_family = ARPHRD_ETHER;
00366     memcpy(wrq.u.ap_addr.sa_data, ap, sizeof(struct ether_addr));
00367     strncpy(wrq.ifr_name, ifname, IFNAMSIZ);
00368     ret = ioctl(sock, SIOCSIWAP, &wrq);
00369     if (ret < 0) WAPI_IOCTL_STRERROR(SIOCSIWAP);
00370 
00371     return ret;
00372 }

00383 
00384 int
00385 wapi_get_bitrate(
00386     int sock,
00387     const char *ifname,
00388     int *bitrate,
00389     wapi_bitrate_flag_t *flag)
00390 {
00391     struct iwreq wrq;
00392     int ret;
00393 
00394     WAPI_VALIDATE_PTR(bitrate);
00395     WAPI_VALIDATE_PTR(flag);
00396 
00397     strncpy(wrq.ifr_name, ifname, IFNAMSIZ);
00398     if ((ret = ioctl(sock, SIOCGIWRATE, &wrq)) >= 0)
00399     {
00400         /* Check if enabled. */
00401         if (wrq.u.bitrate.disabled)
00402         {
00403             WAPI_ERROR("Bitrate is disabled.\n");
00404             return -1;
00405         }
00406 
00407         /* Get bitrate. */
00408         *bitrate = wrq.u.bitrate.value;
00409         *flag = wrq.u.bitrate.fixed ? WAPI_BITRATE_FIXED : WAPI_BITRATE_AUTO;
00410     }
00411     else WAPI_IOCTL_STRERROR(SIOCGIWRATE);
00412 
00413     return ret;
00414 }
00415 
00416 
00417 int
00418 wapi_set_bitrate(
00419     int sock,
00420     const char *ifname,
00421     int bitrate,
00422     wapi_bitrate_flag_t flag)
00423 {
00424     struct iwreq wrq;
00425     int ret;
00426 
00427     wrq.u.bitrate.value = bitrate;
00428     wrq.u.bitrate.fixed = (flag == WAPI_BITRATE_FIXED);
00429 
00430     strncpy(wrq.ifr_name, ifname, IFNAMSIZ);
00431     ret = ioctl(sock, SIOCSIWRATE, &wrq);
00432     if (ret < 0) WAPI_IOCTL_STRERROR(SIOCSIWRATE);
00433 
00434     return ret;
00435 }

00439 
00440 
00441 const char *wapi_txpower_flags[] = {
00442     "WAPI_TXPOWER_DBM",
00443     "WAPI_TXPOWER_MWATT",
00444     "WAPI_TXPOWER_RELATIVE"
00445 };
00446 
00447 
00448 int
00449 wapi_dbm2mwatt(int dbm)
00450 {
00451     return floor(pow(10, (((double) dbm) / 10)));
00452 }
00453 
00454 
00455 int
00456 wapi_mwatt2dbm(int mwatt)
00457 {
00458     return ceil(10 * log10(mwatt));

00460 
00461 
00462 int
00463 wapi_get_txpower(
00464     int sock,
00465     const char *ifname,
00466     int *power,
00467     wapi_txpower_flag_t *flag)
00468 {
00469     struct iwreq wrq;
00470     int ret;
00471 
00472     WAPI_VALIDATE_PTR(power);
00473     WAPI_VALIDATE_PTR(flag);
00474 
00475     strncpy(wrq.ifr_name, ifname, IFNAMSIZ);
00476     if ((ret = ioctl(sock, SIOCGIWTXPOW, &wrq)) >= 0)
00477     {
00478         /* Check if enabled. */
00479         if (wrq.u.txpower.disabled)
00480             return -1;
00481 
00482         /* Get flag. */
00483         if (IW_TXPOW_DBM == (wrq.u.txpower.flags & IW_TXPOW_DBM))
00484             *flag = WAPI_TXPOWER_DBM;
00485         else if (IW_TXPOW_MWATT == (wrq.u.txpower.flags & IW_TXPOW_MWATT))
00486             *flag = WAPI_TXPOWER_MWATT;
00487         else if (IW_TXPOW_RELATIVE == (wrq.u.txpower.flags & IW_TXPOW_RELATIVE))
00488             *flag = WAPI_TXPOWER_RELATIVE;
00489         else
00490         {
00491             WAPI_ERROR("Unknown flag: %d.\n", wrq.u.txpower.flags);
00492             return -1;
00493         }
00494 
00495         /* Get power. */
00496         *power = wrq.u.txpower.value;
00497     }
00498     else WAPI_IOCTL_STRERROR(SIOCGIWTXPOW);
00499 
00500     return ret;
00501 }
00502 
00503 
00504 int
00505 wapi_set_txpower(
00506     int sock,
00507     const char *ifname,
00508     int power,
00509     wapi_txpower_flag_t flag)
00510 {
00511     struct iwreq wrq;
00512     int ret;
00513 
00514     /* Construct the request. */
00515     wrq.u.txpower.value = power;
00516     switch (flag)
00517     {
00518     case WAPI_TXPOWER_DBM:
00519         wrq.u.txpower.flags = IW_TXPOW_DBM;
00520         break;
00521     case WAPI_TXPOWER_MWATT:
00522         wrq.u.txpower.flags = IW_TXPOW_MWATT;
00523         break;
00524     case WAPI_TXPOWER_RELATIVE:
00525         wrq.u.txpower.flags = IW_TXPOW_RELATIVE;
00526         break;
00527     }
00528 
00529     /* Issue the set command. */
00530     strncpy(wrq.ifr_name, ifname, IFNAMSIZ);
00531     ret = ioctl(sock, SIOCSIWTXPOW, &wrq);
00532     if (ret < 0) WAPI_IOCTL_STRERROR(SIOCSIWTXPOW);
00533 
00534     return ret;
00535 }

00540 
00541 struct iw_event_stream {
00542     char *end;      /* end of the stream */
00543     char *current;  /* current event in stream of events */
00544     char *value;        /* current value in event */
00545 };
00546 
00547 
00548 static void
00549 iw_event_stream_init(struct iw_event_stream *stream, char *data, size_t len)
00550 {
00551     memset(stream, 0, sizeof(struct iw_event_stream));
00552     stream->current = data;
00553     stream->end = &data[len];
00554 }

00557 static int
00558 iw_event_stream_pop(
00559     struct iw_event_stream *stream,
00560     struct iw_event *iwe,
00561     int we_version)
00562 {
00563     return iw_extract_event_stream(
00564         (struct stream_descr *) stream, iwe, we_version);
00565 }

00569 
00570 
00571 int
00572 wapi_scan_init(int sock, const char *ifname)
00573 {
00574     struct iwreq wrq;
00575     int ret;
00576 
00577     wrq.u.data.pointer = NULL;
00578     wrq.u.data.flags = 0;
00579     wrq.u.data.length = 0;
00580 
00581     strncpy(wrq.ifr_name, ifname, IFNAMSIZ);
00582     ret = ioctl(sock, SIOCSIWSCAN, &wrq);
00583     if (ret < 0) WAPI_IOCTL_STRERROR(SIOCSIWSCAN);
00584 
00585     return ret;
00586 }
00587 
00588 
00589 int
00590 wapi_scan_stat(int sock, const char *ifname)
00591 {
00592     struct iwreq wrq;
00593     int ret;
00594     char buf;
00595 
00596     wrq.u.data.pointer = &buf;
00597     wrq.u.data.flags = 0;
00598     wrq.u.data.length = 0;
00599 
00600     strncpy(wrq.ifr_name, ifname, IFNAMSIZ);
00601     if ((ret = ioctl(sock, SIOCGIWSCAN, &wrq)) < 0)
00602     {
00603         if (errno == E2BIG)
00604             /* Data is ready, but not enough space, which is expected. */
00605             return 0;
00606         else if (errno == EAGAIN)
00607             /* Data is not ready. */
00608             return 1;
00609 
00610         printf("err[%d]: %s\n", errno, strerror(errno));
00611     }
00612     else WAPI_IOCTL_STRERROR(SIOCGIWSCAN);
00613 
00614     return ret;
00615 }
00616 
00617 
00618 static int
00619 wapi_scan_event(struct iw_event *event, wapi_list_t *list)
00620 {
00621     wapi_scan_info_t *info;
00622 
00623     /* Get current "wapi_info_t". */
00624     info = list->head.scan;
00625 
00626     /* Decode the event. */
00627     switch (event->cmd)
00628     {
00629     case SIOCGIWAP:
00630     {
00631         wapi_scan_info_t *temp;
00632 
00633         /* Allocate a new cell. */
00634         temp = malloc(sizeof(wapi_scan_info_t));
00635         if (!temp)
00636         {
00637             WAPI_STRERROR("malloc()");
00638             return -1;
00639         }
00640 
00641         /* Reset it. */
00642         bzero(temp, sizeof(wapi_scan_info_t));
00643 
00644         /* Save cell identifier. */
00645         memcpy(&temp->ap, &event->u.ap_addr.sa_data, sizeof(struct ether_addr));
00646 
00647         /* Push it to the head of the list. */
00648         temp->next = info;
00649         list->head.scan = temp;
00650         
00651         break;
00652     }
00653 
00654     case SIOCGIWFREQ:
00655         info->has_freq = 1;
00656         info->freq = wapi_freq2float(&(event->u.freq));
00657         break;
00658 
00659     case SIOCGIWMODE:
00660     {
00661         int ret = wapi_parse_mode(event->u.mode, &info->mode);
00662         if (ret >= 0)
00663         {
00664             info->has_mode = 1;
00665             break;
00666         }
00667         else return ret;
00668     }
00669 
00670     case SIOCGIWESSID:
00671         info->has_essid = 1;
00672         info->essid_flag = (event->u.data.flags) ? WAPI_ESSID_ON : WAPI_ESSID_OFF;
00673         memset(info->essid, 0, (WAPI_ESSID_MAX_SIZE + 1));
00674         if ((event->u.essid.pointer) && (event->u.essid.length))
00675             memcpy(info->essid, event->u.essid.pointer, event->u.essid.length);
00676         break;
00677 
00678     case SIOCGIWRATE:
00679         /* Scan may return a list of bitrates. As we have space for only a
00680          * single bitrate, we only keep the largest one. */
00681         if (!info->has_bitrate || event->u.bitrate.value > info->bitrate)
00682         {
00683             info->has_bitrate = 1;
00684             info->bitrate = event->u.bitrate.value;
00685         }
00686         break;
00687     }
00688 
00689     return 0;
00690 }
00691 
00692 
00693 int
00694 wapi_scan_coll(int sock, const char *ifname, wapi_list_t *aps)
00695 {
00696     char *buf;
00697     int buflen;
00698     struct iwreq wrq;
00699     int we_version;
00700     int ret;
00701 
00702     WAPI_VALIDATE_PTR(aps);
00703 
00704     /* Get WE version. (Required for event extraction via libiw.) */
00705     if ((ret = wapi_get_we_version(sock, ifname, &we_version)) < 0)
00706         return ret;
00707 
00708     buflen = IW_SCAN_MAX_DATA;
00709     buf = malloc(buflen * sizeof(char));
00710     if (!buf)
00711     {
00712         WAPI_STRERROR("malloc()");
00713         return -1;
00714     }
00715 
00716 alloc:
00717     /* Collect results. */
00718     wrq.u.data.pointer = buf;
00719     wrq.u.data.length = buflen;
00720     wrq.u.data.flags = 0;
00721     strncpy(wrq.ifr_name, ifname, IFNAMSIZ);
00722     if ((ret = ioctl(sock, SIOCGIWSCAN, &wrq)) < 0 && errno == E2BIG)
00723     {
00724         char *tmp;
00725 
00726         buflen *= 2;
00727         tmp = realloc(buf, buflen);
00728         if (!tmp)
00729         {
00730             WAPI_STRERROR("realloc()");
00731             free(buf);
00732             return -1;
00733         }
00734 
00735         buf = tmp;
00736         goto alloc;
00737     }
00738 
00739     /* There is still something wrong. It's either EAGAIN or some other ioctl()
00740      * failure. We don't bother, let the user deal with it. */
00741     if (ret < 0)
00742     {
00743         WAPI_IOCTL_STRERROR(SIOCGIWSCAN);
00744         free(buf);
00745         return ret;
00746     }
00747 
00748     /* We have the results, process them. */
00749     if (wrq.u.data.length)
00750     {
00751         struct iw_event iwe;
00752         struct iw_event_stream stream;
00753 
00754         iw_event_stream_init(&stream, buf, wrq.u.data.length);
00755         do {
00756             if ((ret = iw_event_stream_pop(&stream, &iwe, we_version)) >= 0)
00757             {
00758                 int eventret = wapi_scan_event(&iwe, aps);
00759                 if (eventret < 0)
00760                     ret = eventret;
00761             }
00762             else WAPI_ERROR("iw_event_stream_pop() failed!\n");
00763         } while (ret > 0);
00764     }
00765 
00766     /* Free request buffer. */
00767     free(buf);
00768 
00769     return ret;
00770 }
Generated on Fri Nov 26 2010 00:09:10 for WAPI by  1.7.1
